intro: Psychotria dolichocalyx, commonly known as the long-stalked psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue berries that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have psychoactive properties.
